intro: Stachys petrokosmos, commonly known as the rock mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in whorls. Stachys petrokosmos is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in arid environments.
